channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: China's Cyber Arsenal Exposed: Knownsec Breach Leaks State Hacking Tools and Global Target Lists
item.description:
A monumental data breach at Knownsec, a prominent Chinese cybersecurity firm with close government ties, has resulted in the exposure of over 12,000 classified documents. The leak, which occurred in early November 2025, provides an unprecedented view into China's offensive cyber capabilities, reveal...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: EU Governments Under Siege: ENISA Reports Massive Surge in DDoS and Data Attacks
item.description:
A new threat landscape report from the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA) reveals that public administrations across the European Union are facing a dramatic increase in cyberattacks. DDoS attacks, largely driven by pro-Russia hacktivist groups like NoName057(16), account for 60% of all incidents, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Hits US Manufacturer Koch & Co., Threatens to Leak 54GB of Data
item.description:
The Akira ransomware group has added U.S. manufacturer Koch & Co., Inc. to its list of victims. In a November 7 post on its dark web leak site, the group claimed to have stolen 54 gigabytes of sensitive corporate data, including detailed financials, contracts, and HR files. Akira is threatening to p...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followe...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese-Made Electric Buses in Europe & Australia Pose Remote Shutdown Risk
item.description:
Cybersecurity tests conducted in Norway on November 7, 2025, have uncovered a significant security risk in Chinese-manufactured Yutong electric buses, which are widely used across Europe and Australia. The 'Lion Cage' experiment demonstrated that the buses' connected systems could theoretically be a...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive 'I Paid Twice' Phishing Scheme Defrauds Booking.com Hotels and Guests
item.description:
A sophisticated global phishing campaign named 'I Paid Twice' is targeting hotels on Booking.com and Expedia, compromising their administrative accounts to defraud guests. Since at least April 2025, attackers have been using social engineering and the PureRAT malware to gain access to hotel systems....

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: State-Backed Hacking Escalates: Russia Targets Ukraine, China Eyes Latin America
item.description:
A new report from ESET reveals a significant escalation in cyber operations by state-sponsored threat groups from Russia and China between April and September 2025. Russia-aligned groups, notably Sandworm, have accelerated destructive wiper malware attacks against Ukraine's critical infrastructure, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

item.title: U.S. Congressional Budget Office Breached by Suspected Foreign Actor
item.description:
The U.S. Congressional Budget Office (CBO), the nonpartisan agency that provides economic analysis to Congress, confirmed on November 6, 2025, that it suffered a significant cybersecurity breach. The attack is suspected to be the work of a foreign government, raising concerns about espionage and the...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cisco Warns of New DoS Attacks Actively Exploiting Firewall Flaws
item.description:
Cisco has issued an urgent warning about a new attack variant actively targeting its Secure Firewall products. Threat actors are chaining two previously disclosed vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-20333 and CVE-2025-20362, to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition on unpatched Adaptive Security Appliance...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hackers Hijack Logistics Systems to Orchestrate Physical Cargo Heists
item.description:
A new and growing form of hybrid crime is targeting the supply chain, where cybercriminals infiltrate freight and logistics companies to facilitate physical cargo theft. According to recent reports, threat actors compromise carrier systems, often using legitimate Remote Monitoring and Management (RM...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence
